abstract: From erosion to withering crops to destroyed dwellings, climate change is affecting the people of Tuvalu in myriad ways.
snippet: From erosion to withering crops to destroyed dwellings, climate change is affecting the people of Tuvalu in myriad ways.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

lead_paragraph: Tuvalu, a tiny archipelago of nine South Pacific islands threatened by rising seas, is on the front lines of the planet's climate change debate. Current projections indicate that it will  become unlivable within 50 years, resulting in an exodus and the erasure of a rich 3,000-year-old culture.

headline.main: As Danger Laps at Its Shores, Tuvalu Pleads for Action
